title: Winter Is Coming | What we're planting now to eat in January

tasks.task: Planting winter crops on a farm
subtasks: Tilling soil and preparing planting beds
Purchasing and germinating seeds (e.g., claytonia, parsley, spinach, carrots, kale)
Setting up protective structures (e.g., caterpillar tunnels, greenhouses)
Watering and maintaining crops during the growing season
Learning about winter farming techniques (Elliot Coleman methods)
Understanding regional climate considerations for winter gardening
Maintaining protective structures (e.g., applying row covers) during cold temperatures
Picking ripe vegetables (e.g., claytonia, parsley, spinach, carrots, kale)
Storing harvested produce for winter consumption
Sharing knowledge and techniques through videos and courses
Encouraging viewers to plant winter crops and build protective greenhouses
Providing links to resource materials (e.g., winter planting calendars, courses)
